metadata.title: CVE-2017-9150 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The do_check function in kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernel before4.11.1 does not make the allow_ptr_leaks value available for restrictingthe output of the print_bpf_insn function, which allows local users toobtain sensitive address information via crafted bpf system calls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-87-generic - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-lowlatency - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-87-generic - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
